How do nanobodies contribute to the dete: They are immobilized on sensor surfaces to capture the S protein.
They degrade the S protein to facilitate detection.
They act as a secondary signal amplifier in the detection process.
They replace the need for any transduction methods.
What is a significant challenge in desig: Ensuring specificity without cross-reactivity to other coronaviruses.
Maintaining large molecular size for better binding.
Reducing stability in various environmental conditions.
What is the primary function of the S1 s: It contains the receptor-binding domain (RBD) that interacts with ACE2.
It is involved in membrane fusion.
It forms the intracellular tail of the spike protein.
It acts as a stabilizing structure for the ectodomain.
What is the role of the S2 subunit in th: It is involved in membrane fusion, allowing viral genome entry.
It forms the large ectodomain of the spike protein.
It interacts directly with the host cell receptor ACE2.
Why are nanobodies considered advantageo: They are stable, cost-effective to produce, and have high tissue penetration.
They are larger and more complex than conventional antibodies.
They require mammalian cell systems for production.
They are less specific than conventional antibodies.
